If \\( h(x) \\) is applied to an initial vector \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve according to \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\) without further intervention, will the result \\( x(t) \\) at t = T be equivalent to what would be obtained if \\( x_0 \\) had not undergone transformation and was simply evolved under \\(\\dot{x} = Dx\\)?
Explanation: The transformation \\( h(x) \\) changes the initial state via the exponential matrix \\( e^{Kt} \\), which potentially modifies the eigenstructure of the initial vector relative to D. This results in a trajectory that diverges from that of the untransformed system.
